website_summaries.verdict: The 4150's reasonable running costs and fast print speed make it a good option forthose who need to pump out a lot of colour pages on a regular basis. Its colour pages are on the dark side, though.
pros: Fast print speed for both colour and B&W documents
cons: Colour pages tend to look darker than they should be

customer_reviews.title: Reliable workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Great color laser printer, it's been very reliable, I'm on my 3rd set of replacement toners. Only a handful of paper jams, love the auto duplex feature, color prints are really good. I have it on my home network, works great. I get generic toner cartridges, for way cheaper than Brother brand, and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Pretends that the toner is empty way before it is.
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly decides it's out of toner when there's plenty left. at 469 pages, the color cartridges are empty, when I hardly ever print color. Then it refuses to even print B/W (though the black cartridge shows at 30%) until you put expensive replacement cartridges in. I found several resources indicating that brother does indeed intentionally expire toner cartridges to induce further sales in their "Razor/Blade" scam model. it's too bad, the printer worked pretty good, but I refuse to be ripped off. Into the garbage it goes, and I'll never buy another Brother product again.
customer_reviews.author: GojiraST

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Its a great small office printer. We have had it for about a year and a half and have had to replace all the included toner cartridges (they are of the "starter" variety). We replaced them one time with the high yield varients and they are going strong. Networked very easily, just assigned it a static IP and Brother still provides driver-only installs which is nice in an office setting (I dislike installing a bunch of crapware just to use a printer). Heres the stats from the printer if it helps: We have printer 6500 pages, the replacement black cartridge has about 1/3 left and the 3 color cartridges are 3/4 full. Doesn't use up an excessive amount of toner.
customer_reviews.author: BILLIAM

customer_reviews.title: Best Brother laser printer ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best printer that Brother has ever made. This is my second one for my business. If you want true color for your prints this is the printer To purchase. Unfortunately Brother no longer makes this printer so you’ll have to search high and low to find it. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Best Color Printer ever - if price is important
customer_reviews.text: I do accounting work but like having some color to my black and white job. This is my second 4150, I also bought the MFC9970CDW which cannot be beaten for quality, speed and functions. Anyway the 4150 works flawlessly for me, the last one gave me approximately 25,000 pages, before the black drum went out. It was cheaper to buy a new one than to replace drum. Listen - for small businesses - this can't be beat for the quality and price. I paid $249 for my first one and $219 for the second.
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best printers I ever used
customer_reviews.text: One of the best printers I ever used. Good quality of printing, affordable (by comparing to other manufacturers) toner cartridges. I thing the estimated number of pages per cartridge is exaggerated. Setting of the network connection is the easiest you can get, Brother also offers excellent software for Linux.
customer_reviews.author: RF researcher

customer_reviews.title: Never go back to HP
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have had 3 HP color laser printers, with duplexing. This Brother unit replaced the last HP laser color with this unit and it out performs all the other HP printers hands down. While its really not photo quality printing, let's not kid ourselves. True photo quality printing is difficult to get unless it is a professional machine. The HL4150's speed and duplex features make up for that. Networking was a snap and toner is reasonable. Good by to HP printers! Anyone want t two older HP's. Free for the shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I used this printer to print a job that was about 3,600 pages. The duplexing worked great. My only complaint was about half way through it said I was out of black ink. I reset the ink cartridges by using the other reviewer's instructions and finished my print job. I don't know why Brother has to fool consumers into buying ink well before the ink is really empty especially with the price of ink cartridges. It would have gotten 5 stars, if it hadn't been for the deceptive ink practices.
customer_reviews.author: Writer4kids

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, fast startup, descent color, overall nice unit
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through 4 other Color Lasers in the past 5 years at the clinic. Each had problems, the worst of which were the HPs (slow to start, costly to operate, and demanding to maintain). This unit is fast at startup, really fast. It pumps out pages quickly once it gets going (not at the rate of a huge unit but for its class - very good). Colors are fine, nothing special but no complaints. It installed easily without any problems on our network. So far , after a couple months use, its a solid performer for us.
customer_reviews.author: PPS

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great laser printer at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I am now a Brother Laser Printer customer and not Xerox! I had a Xerox Phaser 6280 that was only a couple of months old with only 1200 copies on it. The paper kept jamming in the fuser. They kept sending me new fusers and nothing worked. I finally got sick of it, took my losses and purchased this gem of a printer. It was so easy to set up on my Mac Computer and the network! I purchased the extra memory so it is very fast. The quality is better than the Xerox and the price of the toner is better as well! Thanks Brother! You now have a lifelong customer! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laser printer
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit noisier than our previous printer but we are very happy with the speed and quality of this printer. Especially like being able to print duplex. The paper tray handles either legal or letter sized paper (our previous printer couldn't handle legal in the regular paper tray). Paper and toner are both easy to load. It is interesting that the price has bounced around quite a bit as noted by another reviewer. He got his for $250, we got ours for $299, it is currently at $331. Probably reflects demand and favorable reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Oey

customer_reviews.title: My new printer!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Brother 4150CDN printer several days ago and had it set up and working in short order. This is my 3rd Brother printer and they just keep getting better. I write books and sell them on Amazon.com. In the past, I would print the covers and the pages with color pictures and drawings on a HP Photosmart Printer. I can now print a whole book on the Brother 4150CDN printer with professional looking results. The quality great! This is a large heavy printer and the machine sure does the job for me..
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Helm

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months and cannot believe the quality you get (great) for the money. A duplex color laser printer that is fast and works on a network or connected to a computer. I have it on a network and we use it from our Mac computers without problems. The output quality is very good as well. Its a little loud when it starts up with fan noises so you might not enjoy sitting next to it if it's used all day long. It's also rather large.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great, but needs some fine tuning by a human hand
customer_reviews.text: Prints awesome, very clear and color correct. I am a printing press operator so quality is very important to me. When I first printed something, the colors were not lined up. I needed to run the manual registration about 5 times in a row before I got it exactly in register. The Automatic registration was way off, but its nice that you have the feature of manually lining up the colors. So far so good. Each time you run the manual registration and folow the instructions, it gets closer to being perfect, like I said it took me 5 consecutive manual registrations to get it correct. It is a large machine, keep this in mind when purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: Printer has worked perfectly since I bought it 9 months ago. Only a few hiccups here and there, all of which were network related and not printer related. Drivers are easy to install and typically don't even require additional downloads or cds. Got this at a great price during one of Amazon's sales. The toner that comes with this printer lasts quite a while also. In 9 months I've only had to change the cyan. This is also after printing 500+ pages (recent college grad here, so you know I've printed a lot). Mine is configured using an ethernet cable. Overall A+
customer_reviews.author: A. Liang

customer_reviews.title: Big and Loud but Fast!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice colors and clear printing. (You do want to change the default print settings under Advanced to turn off the 'Improve Grey Color' or you'll have the color issues others reported.) Prints super fast even when duplexing. Cons: Huge/heavy, and loud when printing. P.S. Someone else commented on the smell...it was a bit smelly during the first few prints, but it has since cleared up so I think that was just burn in.
customer_reviews.author: LLMommyM

customer_reviews.title: If you need a great color printer the Brother 4150 is a great choice
customer_reviews.text: Last year my computer crashed, my operating system was Windows XP. I purchased a new computer with Windows 7 because I could not purchase a new computer with XP, my current HP laser printer was not compatible, so I purchased the Brother 4150. I have used Brother products in the past and was pleased with them. Very impressed this printer and would recommend it to anyone needing a color printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for PCB transferring, a bit jammy tho
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. I use it for making PCBs. It has a decent amount of settings that I can use to dial in the quality of the PCBs, which turn out really well. I'm pumping out 0805 SMDs with no problem at all. A bit of this has to do with the mac print settings I think. It would be better if it jam so much. It does tend to jam quite a bit when using the front loading tray. I use Vice magazines as they seem to transfer the toner the best I've found. Colour quality is great. No problems with documents or regular paper. Not set up the network stuff at all. Maybe another day.
customer_reviews.author: Sound Advice

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this was just a Lemon
customer_reviews.text: The color was dull and non glossy ( I was expecting this from other reviews). The manual input tray was very touchy. After a few days it started printing black spots on every page. I called brother for assistance twice and was put on hold for over 15 minutes each time and hung up. I have a black and white Brother laser which I am impressed with, but this particular printer seems sub standard. I returned it and bought another brand which I am very satisfied with.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Dependable printer
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable printer, so much so that we've bought more for use in other parts of the office. Fast enough for small jobs and works well. Runs out of color toner faster than I would like, hence one star deducted, but that's common for most printers these days. This is a good work horse for home office or small business environments.
customer_reviews.author: GGP

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, no issues after 6+months of use
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great, and I have had no problems since getting it. That's about all I can say, as it's done its job completely. Build quality is almost suspect, meaning when I pull the paper tray out I feel I could break it if I were a bit careless in the process. Make sure you purchase ink (forget the laser term for it) as the ones that come with the printer will run out very quickly-- they are like 20% of a normal cartridge. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: highflow

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. I've had it about a year now. Unfortunately I dropped my laptop on it the day after I got it and cracked the display. However, that hasn't hindered it from performing well at all. The cartridges it came with lasted a good 1000 pages. When comparing how much I would've spent at kinkos for that it more than made up for the cast of the printer. I like that I can still print when a color cartridge runs out by just having it print in black and white. Replacement cartridges get spendy-- but then again-- a lot better priced in the long run vs going to kinkos. Prints pretty fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Maysah

customer_reviews.title: Prints nice but slow
customer_reviews.text: I gave up on HP printers, as their quality has gone way down from where they were, and they have a bazillion different types of toner. This printer prints nice, but it's a little slow to get going if it's in sleep mode... but for the price it's a great value, and the toner is reasonably priced too. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BD Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Between Separate Subnets
customer_reviews.text: Love working with these as they can work with different subnets. I.E. I install the printer on our main network and make a firewall rule to allow another subnet to see the printer's IP and bam! I will say that if you use the cheap-o paper that's super thin (paper-thin?), it will curl your printouts. Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: ProfessionalProduction

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. The quality of color printing is excellent, easy to use and has some nice features. For the price, it's super. I liked it so much, I bought one for my wife (she never did get the hang of wi-fi and we can interchange cartridges)
customer_reviews.author: Taijiquan

customer_reviews.title: Blurry printer
customer_reviews.text: I am honestly extremely disappointed with my purchase. The printer was making a loud sound and the images were blurry. Before I bought it, I called and spoke to someone from TMAC who assured me that the printer was tested and it works but that was untrue. I am returning the item immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color, Laser, Duplex, Networked (Wired) - awesome for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Sharp colors, easy set-up. I set it up as a wired-networked printer by connecting it to Fios modem. PCs need the CD to install software. Macs were able to find the software and install the printer automatically without requiring the CD. Excellent duplex feature. It is heavy though and has a large foot print. Not an issue for me but might be for some.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Allen

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this so far
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for only a few months, but so far we are very pleased with it. It's connected to our computers and mobile devices via wifi. Works quietly and reliably so far. We use it mostly for B&W text printing, but the color pictures we've printed on thick paper or card stock are beautiful. Have had some paper jams when printing two-sided on premium paper.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: Good Color Laser Printer with Duplex option
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for about 3 weeks now, and I like this printer as it was easy to set up and it worked right out of the box. The only issue I would have liked was better color matching as it is color but has no glossyness to it and some colors show to be dull or not exactly correct. For my purposes, it will work as a color printer and the duplex feature is very nice as it save paper and doesn't create a problem of trying to manually try it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Its a good machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: We are replacing a machine that was just getting more expense to keep replacing the parts instead of getting a new one. We had a OKI before, and while this machine isn't up to the same quality that the OKI produced, it is still a great quality. The OKI did great glossy prints, and even though these prints aren't glossy it is still good enough for our most important presentations. It could be better if you need the very top quality, but for the price it is perfect for what we need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Easy to use.  OK copies.
customer_reviews.text: It is compact yet heavy. It sets up quickly. It makes copies fast. Color is not accurate for photo printing (too dark) but may be good enough. (Lots of online comments about this.) Use Toner Saver mode for better/lighter photo printing. Replacement cartridges are expensive but big $$ can be saved by refilling with bottled powder by SOL also available on this site.
customer_reviews.author: Frumious

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd gotten this years ago instead of the HP all-in-one printer ink jet; prints beautifully every time - and it has true duplex so you save money on paper. Cartridges are sold for a good price here on Amazon, too. Very sturdy and heavy printer, unlike the HP ones. VERY MUCH WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: Treeline

customer_reviews.title: Fast printing, quality color, duplex. Great for a home office or small workgroup.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic print quality, good color, very fast printing. Plugged into my Wi-Fi access point via Ethernet and have wireless printing from anywhere on my network now. I love the duplexing and the straight paper path option, which I use for heavier stock and envelopes.
customer_reviews.author: modulated

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, noisy, and smells
customer_reviews.text: I don't hate this printer (as my title might imply). But the nature of laser vs. ink jet is sort of just that. While I loathe paying for the 'blades' (ink cartridges) of the ink jets, the sheer bulk, noise, smell, and, most of all poor color rendering, forced my hand in this review. I really thought the colors would look better. Perhaps I didn't tweak the driver settings enough, but that's not my gig - tweaking driver settings to get something passable for color.
customer_reviews.author: Dev Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for our overpriced Xerox
customer_reviews.text: After the second Xerox wax deposition printer died due to poor quality construction, we bought this Brother. We own a few other Brother B/W printers on our network and they work impeccably well. The only complaint is the high cost of consumables. However, Amazon's prices are a bit better on those.
customer_reviews.author: Stan R

customer_reviews.title: High toner use
customer_reviews.text: The print quality and speed are actually quite good. This printer gets one star because of the high toner use and poor tech support. After 5 months of use, each time one toner cartridge runs out, they all have to be replaced. That's a cost of about $300. Tech support says that shouldn't happen and they had some suggestions. But the suggestions were useless and they were unable to help me solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: LIFE CYCLE OF THE TONER IS REALLY LOW
customer_reviews.text: I GOT LOW TONER WARNING ON CYAN. AND A COUPLE OF DAYS LATER PRINTER STOPPED PRINTING. I RESET THE LOW TONER INDICATOR AND PRINT WITHOUT REPLACING TONER. I SAW OTHER COLORS WARNINGS BUT I RESET AND USE FOR A LONG LONG TIME(MORE THAN 3 MONTHS). I TRUSTED BROTHER FOR A LONG TIME BUT NOT ON THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: AmazoningSince'05

customer_reviews.title: OK  at first, then issues.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 years then pages started 'streaking' with ink stains. Costs $175 for service call to fix. Trashed and purchased an HP printer/scanner. Much better!
customer_reviews.author: heco 5375

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for the Money and setup up
customer_reviews.text: After many years of paying for the ink cartridges, I finally got a laser. Don't know why I waited so long. One important thing for me is that it can run with Ubuntu Linux. And this printer works great with Ubuntu. I am using Ubuntu 12.04 and had to install the driver manually, but Thank you Brother for supporting my operating system and providing a driver and clear directions. Makes this choice not only great for the quality print I am getting out of it, but also for a company that supports Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer!

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: In a word, this printer is perfect for home use. The size is a bit smaller than our previous Minolta model, and it is a ton faster. The prints look good and the unit is not very loud at all. I like the web management. Toner and paper access is nice and simple. I would buy this again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: B. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Supplies are a little pricey, but fine printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fine. Photos sometimes come out with weird saturation compared with the HP we used to have. If you can afford a $1500 printer, you can save a lot on supplies, but in general seems to be reliable and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JonnyTex

customer_reviews.title: Great for dissertation!
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. Fast and reliable. We printed a 330 page dissertation on fine laser printer paper and it came out looking great. The issues were that the paper we used was a heavy short grain so it came out of the printer curled more than we wanted and when we had it bound, the curl was still there. It's enough to be noticeable. The book binder said it was the paper that needed to be long grain so we will know for next time. It is slightly loud for a small room or office but you could still have a telephone conversation when it's printing.
customer_reviews.author: Dz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job, had to print a lot of lab reports in color and this greatly brought down my cost. With the amount I print pretty sure it will last forever and has very good print quality on full color photos when you use special laser photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: SchoolBiker

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, till it stopped working properly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer for twice a year reasonably heavy use. We used it once in June, and once in August. Loved the functionality, but in August, it started malfunctioning. Sadly, I waited too long to try to have it replaced, because we use it so infrequently, but wanted to put the warning out for others. We printed a few thousand pages on it, replaced the ink cartridges (yes, with genuine cartridges, OUCH the cost!) and it became unusable for us. I'd suggest testing it out upon arrival to you, so that if it malfunctions, you are still within a reasonable window to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Frost

customer_reviews.title: a great low production printer
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a heavy print load. When we do print, though, we need color or duplexing or other requirements that are all handled by this printer. I went to buy it locally and found out it had been discontinued. I went immediately online to purchase it. We have had three of these now, and they are all great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Beers

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: This Brother is everything they said it would be. The only slight negatives are that the pages come out somewhat curled and the colors are not as bright as I'd like. Other than that it is fast, reliable, and the ink per page is reasonably priced. Love the duplex feature. Huge improvement over the piece of junk HP 8500 Officejet printer it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Goldfinger

customer_reviews.title: Solid printer.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer a few months now. The price was good and the printer is dependable with good capacity. I always check a printer's toner price before I buy it and this one is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The printer makes excellent copies and the various printing options are excellent for my needs. The only complaint I have is the need to open the machine from the back and flip a lever before printing envelopes. Then you have to do the same before printing paper. Kind of a pain, but for the price I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: shipmodeler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I have used inkjet printers up to this time and I wanted a laser printer with duplexing for home office and for personal use. This is a very fast and very good quality printer. I wired my house with CAT5 so I just plugged it into my network and set up the drivers on my computers and it was ready to go. I expect this to be slightly less expensive to operate than an inkjet and the quality is definitely as good if not better in some ways. In all ways, it is way faster, especially for a multi-page duplex job which is one of the primary reasons I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Well, it came today!It was so simple to set up - even I could do it. It is shared throughout the house and that setup was easy too. Brilliant colors and very fast printing. This replaced an old HP-4600 and is night and day! First Brother printer ever - I am a believer. A very economical solution!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Devan

customer_reviews.title: Its an OK printer for the price however it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Its an OK printer for the price however it is loud (which we already knew from others' feedback but it takes forever to send a print job to it... it freezes the computers... Again you get what you pay for but I wouldnt buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: We appreciate that there are Linux drivers for most Brother printers. We use Linux (Ubuntu) and we decide what hardware to buy based on whether or not the company supports Linux OS. We haven't had the machine but a few weeks and used a few times, but the images look great and it prints fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B. Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Big but really nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large printer I really thought it would be smaller. I would hate to give this less then a 5. it is really my fault that I did not read the foot print listed. Much quieter then my old printer and works great picture quality is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong...
customer_reviews.text: This Brother printer is located at our client site and is used by 10+ folks on both Mac and Windows based laptops. The prints come out clean and crisp and so far so good. We like everything about this printer. Terrific price, too.
customer_reviews.author: AJMitch1

customer_reviews.title: Solid workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Good reliable printer. We have been giving it a heavy workout in the office and it performs very reliably. Print quality is excellent, and two sided printing is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: yohmama

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a color laser
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a color laser. Does slightly curl paper when using duplex but does not affect Sunday church program we do every week. Color is great.
customer_reviews.author: TOM Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a year of normal use
customer_reviews.text: After just over one year of normal use, I now get Print Unable E1 error message, it doesn't connect via the network, and it has a mechanical failure and I don't know what has failed. Won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$$ I paid almost 2 years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the $$$ I paid almost 2 years ago. It even survived a moved across country. I'd buy one again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of printing and this printer has been a work horse for me. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great Color Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: Always had great luck with the Brother model printers after becoming a very unhappy and frustrated HP printer owner. We upgraded from the Brother 2140 which only printed in B&W(but we loved it! excellent choice if you don't need color. We are very pleased so far, we have owned it for a month or two, still fast and crisp. The color is a great added feature, and we still haven't changed out the demo cartridges yet. We havent did any actual pictures yet, but is great for standard documents you need done in color.
customer_reviews.author: Exie Brewington

customer_reviews.title: MY FOURTH COLOR LASER PRINTER AND THE BEST YET!
customer_reviews.text: The price is incredible for a duplex printing, color laser printer. Can't go wrong. I've owned Dell and Oki and this one is the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Work horse. Pumps out a lot of printing quickly. Had a MFC before and terribly slow with things breaking all the time. Now bought printer and scanner separately and it working for us.
customer_reviews.author: Berky

customer_reviews.title: ... be set up for wireless printing this would be perfect, but can't even use it through a hub
customer_reviews.text: If this was able to be set up for wireless printing this would be perfect, but can't even use it through a hub.....
customer_reviews.author: Jim AWC(AC) USN Ret

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good deal and it works well, be advised: they should give it away for what the cartridges cost, the first set of replacement cartridges (I have not needed them yet and I bought high yield)(requires 4) bought directly from Brother (less expensive than Amazon) cost almost twice as much as the printer
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: works great, does draw power
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great and is FAST. It is louder than ink jets, but no louder than any other laser printer. Get the memory upgrade for even more performance.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the printing for the price of this printer is unbeatable. Best tech purchase I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: good price good value
customer_reviews.text: how it build is amazing. and everything is perfect for me. fast print, deep sleep mode is also. really well build
customer_reviews.author: P. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Brother printer with duplexing and decided to buy a color printer. This printer was much bigger than I anticipated, but it has terrific print quality and was easy to load onto my computers and network.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY L CONVERSE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer. Doesn't have the bells and whistles of ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Doesn't have the bells and whistles of an HP printer, but print quality is super.
customer_reviews.author: The_cow_goes_NAY

customer_reviews.title: great deal for great printer
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, print quality is excellent, drivers easy to search/install, I highly recommend this for small office and personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Printing Workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was purchase for work. It prints out beautiful color images in a snap. Its pretty much usable directly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lili Romero-Riddell

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST Laser printer out there
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST Laser printer out there, its my second one we purchased and would buy a third if we needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great color printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer serves 4 computers, 2 phones, and 2 IPads. Output is quick and quality high. It is a heavy duty network printer
customer_reviews.author: J. Bloomer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for 4 months and have not been disappointed. It is fast and the color is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ktrmom

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, but
customer_reviews.text: This printer does a good job, but is slow to warm up, and somewhat noisy in operation. Setting up the 'defaults' such as duplex needs to be covered better, since THIS is NOT done on the printer, but on the computer; it should tell you this! Required a firmware update on installation.
customer_reviews.author: DDT

customer_reviews.title: Best laser color printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer is solid and network-enabled with a ton of features. best of which is the sleep mode when idling.
customer_reviews.author: bruce The dragon

customer_reviews.title: Good color printer for me
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model for a couple of years now and it has worked fine with decent quality color images. I don't do large volume printing though. It's pretty big. I have been happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: K Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the printing industry for 30 years. Though the color is not great (saturated and muddy), the print is clear crisp and clean. It is very easy to set up for both Mac and Pc platforms. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a school. It is not the fastest but for the price it is great. I have bought brother before because it is one cheapest to refill. I will buy one more for an other office.
customer_reviews.author: steve finke

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good printer for the price. I am pleased with my purchase and the printer was very easy to set up. I used it to print wedding invitations and they came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Sanovia Sands

customer_reviews.title: It does its job
customer_reviews.text: It just takes a really, really long time loading up. That's the only issue that I have, really. Other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: MZetouna

customer_reviews.title: Bar-none
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it, so happy I found it open box, totally worth full price though. You will be happy if you buy this printer, I use it for home because I run a website and we print things every once in a while, but this is perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Knight

customer_reviews.title: Have to use a flashdrive to save the document to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have to use a flashdrive to save the document to print. It doesn't print Word Documents only PDF form and in that form the format changes. I wish I never purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: David Schmidhausler

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: With in a few months, this thing began printing at random. Now my document feeder does not work. It has been nothing but problems since I got this printer. Unfortunately, the bigger issues did not occur till after the return policy was up. I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Purdum

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Picked this for my at home office. So far after several weeks it works well! Good color and zero problems as you'd expect. Does take longer to warm up after "sleeping" than the Dell it replaced, but all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Willard L. Boward

customer_reviews.title: nice color duplex printer
customer_reviews.text: this is an excellent color/duplex printer. the quality is good, easy setup and it works
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Warp speed printing
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer. Super fast. High quality finish. Highly recommend to anyone who prints a lot or who doesn't like waiting.
customer_reviews.author: JB56

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Print quality could be better but a workhorse. A little slow to start up but acceptable. YouTube the videos that extend your print cartridges for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Al H.

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and features for a low-cost laser printer. Very pleased with this printer. Will buy brother printing products again.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Seek

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using for a few months and I love it! The extra paper feed in the front is perfect because I use that to feed checks through.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: awesome printer.
customer_reviews.text: perfect laser printer, never had any issues with it. exactly as described! this item came quickly to my house and is what I was looking for. thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T

customer_reviews.title: Gave this printer as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I have not actually even seen this printer as I had it shipped directly to my son, who lives in another state. However he did tell me that it works great for him. He was mostly interested in printing pictures and it does a great job at that.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO PLUG IN AND BECAUSE I OWN A MAC IT IS EASY TO SET UP. GOOD COLOR, CLEAN PRINT
customer_reviews.author: pohakea

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Have had good luck with other brother printers in the past. But new printer arrived today Set it all up and turned it on got message "Print Unable 42." Brother tells us it is a mechanical failure. They are sending "new one", we will see but disconcerting when they ask for your credit card up front. I will update as the saga unloads. John
customer_reviews.author: John E Winske

customer_reviews.title: Great printer...love it
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I have ever owned...priced right...easy set up...Brother makes the best printers...fast on time delivery...purchased another black and white printer after using this one
customer_reviews.author: bbbbadwizard

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!! You don't need the wireless version!!
customer_reviews.text: OKAY!! Okay, okay, okay, okay, okay... Listen up, people! I don't know about Windows products; however, by going into the system preferences and turning on Printer Sharing, your MacBook can connect through your iMac and print directly and wirelessly. YOU DO NOT NEED THE WIRELESS VERSION OF THIS PRINTER. You can save hundreds of dollars by simply turning on the ability in your Mac to allow your other devices (iPad, iPhone, iPod, etc.) to speak to the printer through your desktop. The printer is a little loud, but I don't care. The color is strong, and it's a breeze to set up. I look forward to taking over the world from my home office.
customer_reviews.author: DancerJack

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: The linux drivers installation is a bit harder than an HP but it does install in the end. The price point is very excellent. The results are much better than our previous inkjet. And without glitches.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bucher

customer_reviews.title: Brother Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: We tried and tried to connect this printer, but could never make it be recognized by my new iMac computer. Thus, I sent it back and received a full refund---thank goodness! I have since purchased a Samsung Laser Printer; it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: marsh23

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THE PRINTER. EASY TO USE, GOOD QUALITY & VERY GOOD SPEED. I HAVE A NEWLY BROKEN WRIST & STILL EVERYTHING IS EASY TO DO!!
customer_reviews.author: GRANDY

customer_reviews.title: Great COLOR Laser printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! Decided to go laser after having endless ink issues with inkjet print of late. Pros: Duplexing, speed and quality Cons: It's a laser so the graphics do not come out as detailed or sharp as an inkjet, but I expected that. I have already recommended this product to colleagues at work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Welch, Jr.

product_meta.title: Brother HL4150CDN Color Laser Printer with Duplex and Networking
product_meta.description: The hl-4150cdn is a high-performance, network-ready color laser printer ideal for offices or small workgroups. it produces brilliant, high-quality output at an impressive print speed of up to 25 pages per minute in color and black. it features automatic duplex printing for two-sided documents and produces impactful color business documents at up to 2400 x 600 dpi resolution. also, high-yield replacement toner cartridges are available.
feature_bullets: Up to 25ppm color and black printing
High-yield 6000-page black and 3500-page color replacement toner cartridges available

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars220 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
